quizzes.title: History Quiz: Humphrey Bogart and Film Noir Genre
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, philip, presidents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The famous fictional modern detective Philip Marlowe was played by many actors over the years, from Humphrey Bogart to Elliot Gould.  Can you name the author who created him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raymond Chandler

questions.question: The Killers was a film based on a short story written by Ernest Hemingway, which starred Burt Lancaster and Ava Gardner.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Mildred Pierce put Joan Crawfords name back up there in lights.  It was nominated for several Academy Awards.  Both Ann Blyth and Eve Arden were nominated for Best Supporting Actress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Nails and hair continue to grow even after you die.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Said to be the first of the Film Noir genre, The Maltese Falcon starred Humphrey Bogart as the one and only Sam Spade.  How many appearances did Bogart make as this character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1

questions.question: Periander of Corinth, Pittacus of Mitylene and Thales of Miletus have something in common. What is it?

options.text: They are three of the most famous Greek characters.
They are three of the Seven mathematicians of Greece.
They are the Three princes of Greece.
They are three of the Seven Sages of Greece.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are three of the Seven Sages of Greece.

questions.question: A notable movie in the Film Noir genre is Out of the Past.  This movie featured Robert Mitchum as Jeff Bailey, who is forced to confront his past by one unsavory adversary, played by an actor who is not known for his roles playing a heavy.  Name him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kirk Douglas

questions.question: In 1971 one of the classics of the Film Noir genre was made in color - Chinatown.  The cast was stellar, as well as the director.  Can you name him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Polanski

questions.question: Laura is one of the most memorable films made in the Film Noir genre, even more so thanks to Clifton Webbs performance.  What was his film characters name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waldo Lydecker

questions.question: The Spanish word for dog is pero.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: These US Presidents - William Henry Harrison, Zachary Taylor, Franklin D. Roosevelt, and Warren G. Harding, all have this in common.

options.text: They have been elected without a plurality of popular votes.
They died in office of natural causes.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They died in office of natural causes.

questions.question: A lion is part of which animal class?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mammalia

questions.question: Three of the listed singers are baritones. Who is the odd one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roberto Alagna

questions.question: Body Heat, written and directed by Lawrence Kasdan of Star Wars, has everything; scheming lovers, murder, blackmail and betrayal.  Can you name the actor who played Matty Walkers doomed husband, Edmund?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Crenna

questions.question: What 2 prominent actors did the movie Colors star?

options.text: Sean Penn and Robert De Niro

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sean Penn and Robert Duvall

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Psychologists and Medals
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, les, ehrlich. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which answer best describes how many Congressional Medal of Honor medals were awarded during the Civil War
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Between 1200 and 2000

questions.question: Which group consists of these three members: Thomas (Tom) Matthew DeLonge on guitar, Markus (Mark) Allan Hoppus on bass, and Travis Landon Barker on drums?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blink-182

questions.question: Rabbi Levi and Rabbi Abraham ibn Ezra are places on the moon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What organization was started by Carrie Chapman Catt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: League of Women Voters

questions.question: What was the name of Sir Isaac Newtons first wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He never had a wife

questions.question: Which sport is mentioned in Shakespeares Henry V?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tennis

questions.question: Which of these psychologists was not a student of Freuds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulrich Neisser

questions.question: Who was the first singer to get a Gold Record for a single?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Perry Como

questions.question: Who is the odd one of the four writers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Dickens

questions.question: When did Americas military actions in Korea first begin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1871

questions.question: He was a great silent screen star.  He was well known as the best pie thrower in the movies.  He was a great athlete and did almost all of his own stunts.  He was famous for rarely showing emotion in his face.  Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buster Keaton

questions.question: Tomas Transtrmer, Assia Djebar and Raja Rao have won one, what is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neustadt International Prize for Literature

questions.question: Paul Ehrlich, Otto Diels, and Hans Fischer are known as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: German chemists

questions.question: What did Jean Michel Jarre, Ernest Hemingway, Mark Twain, Lord Byron, and Sir Winston Churchill all have for pets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cats

questions.question: Les Barker, Richard Digance and Bill Oddie are famous for being what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Musical comedians

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Rabbit and Fear
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, condition, disneys. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which term is defined as fear of crowds, public places or open areas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Agoraphobia

questions.question: Which of these cartoon characters is Bugs Bunnys rival?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these was supposedly built to house 8 human hairs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Shwedagon Pagoda

questions.question: Which of these is characteristic of Rabbit, a fictional character in the series Winnie the Pooh?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Busy and responsible

questions.question: Which one of these authors created the famous fictional White Rabbit which wears a waistcoat and is always worried about being late?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lewis Carrol

questions.question: Who played the role of Jimmy B-Rabbit in the 2002 movie 8 Mile, directed by Curtis Hanson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eminem

questions.question: Who discovered the gyroscope effect, now used for measuring orientation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johann Bohenberger

questions.question: Who voiced Roger Rabbit in the 1988 movie Who Framed Roger Rabbit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Fleischer

questions.question: The Playboy Bunny outfit, worn by waitresses at the Playboy Clubs, consisted of bunny ears, a corset, a collar, cuffs and what else?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fluffy tail

questions.question: Which American author wrote the so called Rabbit novels - Rabbit, Run, Rabbit Redux, Rabbit Is Rich, Rabbit At Rest and Rabbit Remembered?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Updike

questions.question: Which condition is described as a fear of cats?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ailurophobia

questions.question: Who wrote and illustrated the famous childrens book The Tale of Peter Rabbit, first published in 1902?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beatrix Potter

questions.question: Which characters drink tea together with the March Hare at the neverending tea party in Alices Adventures in Wonderland?

options.text: The Duchess and the Mad Hatter
The Dormouse and the Mad Hatter

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dormouse and the Mad Hatter

questions.question: What was the name of the rabbit in Disneys animated movie Bambi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thumper

questions.question: Which disorder is characterised by a fear of the number 13?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Triskaidekaphobia

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Fear and Condition
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, condition, heights. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Steven Spielbergs movie, The Color Purple,  was nominated for 11 Academy Awards, how many did it actually win?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0

questions.question: Who were the feuding enemies of the McCoys?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hat fields

questions.question: Which is not a shade of purple?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vermilion

questions.question: Which is a successful Australian comedy film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alvin Purple

questions.question: What did the Byzantine empresses do in the Purple Chamber?

options.text: Rest in to be seen by others during their final days of life

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Give Birth

questions.question: Of the following, which is a British rock band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deep Purple

questions.question: What condition is characterised by an irrational fear of taking tests?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Testophobia

questions.question: What medical term refers to the fear of death or dying?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thanatophobia

questions.question: A person who is afraid of heights, suffers from what disorder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Acrophobia

questions.question: What term refers to the fear of imperfection?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atelophobia

questions.question: Which condition is described as an excessive fear of animals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zoophobia

questions.question: Which term refers to the morbid fear of thunderstorms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brontophobia

questions.question: Purple is the official color of what Hawaiian Island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kauai

questions.question: Which terms means an irrational fear of the sea or the ocean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thalassophobia

questions.question: Leonard Kessler wrote a childrens book called Mr. Pines Purple House.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Evil and Reporters
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Monticello, meaning small mountain in Italian, is the name of an estate near Charlottesville, Virginia, which belonged to which US President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: When something is especially cleaned one is said to have applied polish and ..........  to it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spit

questions.question: The Japanese words Mizaru, Kikazaru and Iwazaru, which embody the proverbial principle to see no evil, to hear no evil, and to speak no evil refer to what?

options.text: The Japanese names for the Biblical characters Shadrack, Meshaxk, and Abendebego.
The names of the three diamonds in the Mitsubishi logo.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The three wise monkeys.

questions.question: The two reporters who exposed the Watergate scandal were Bernstein and this person.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Woodward

questions.question: How many people signed the US Declaration of Independence on July 4,1776?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: What are the main ingredients of the traditional English dish Bubble and Squeak?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Potato and cabbage

questions.question: According to Dr. Seuss, what goes with ham?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green eggs

questions.question: Norwegian inventor, Johan Vaaler was granted a patent in Germany, in 1899, for the invention of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The paperclip

questions.question: What goes along with love according to a Frank Sinatra hit song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marriage

questions.question: Which of the following is the title of one of Aesops most famous fables?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fox and the Grapes

questions.question: On July 26, 1948, US President Harry S. Truman issued Executive Order 9981, which established what?

options.text: The right of women to vote
The House Committee on Un-American Activities (HUAC)
Equality of treatment and opportunity in the Armed Services for people of all races

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Equality of treatment and opportunity in the Armed Services for people of all races

questions.question: What were the first names of the comedy team of Abbot and Costello?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bud and Lou

questions.question: Who was Dale Evans married to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roy Rogers

questions.question: This Italian singer, who  won the San Remo Music Festival twice, became popular in the United States in the 1950s with his song Volare.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Domenico Modugno

questions.question: The English poet William Blake wrote two beautiful poems concerning what two animals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The tiger and the lamb

questions.question: Elliott Coues, William Brewster and Joel Asaph Allen founded this union in September 1883.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: American Ornithologists Union

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Batman

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leukopenia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eating Disorder

questions.question: Which of the following persons was not a Prime Minister of Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chaim Weizmann

questions.question: In this Indo-European language, which has 11 vowels and 35 consonants, postpositions are used instead of prepositions.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hindi

questions.question: In the 1957 movie Twelve Angry Men what was the occupation of the character, played by Henry Fonda?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: architect

questions.question: In 1891, this successful Ohio City businessman made Americas first gasoline-powered automobile.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lambert

questions.question: Which of the following artists does not produce trance music?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Van Morrison

questions.question: David Seaman, Ian Wright, John Jensen, Dennis Bergkamp, David Platt, Patrick Vieira, Marc Overmars, Fredrik Ljungberg, and Thierry Henry are top players who have all played for one of the following soccer clubs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arsenal FC

questions.question: Fyodor Tyutchev, Nikolai Alekseevich Nekrasov and Evgeny Baratynsky were Russian poets and are usually related to this period of Russian literature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 19th century

questions.question: Professor Sir Alec John Jeffreys, who was awarded the Albert Einstein World Award of Science in 1996, is famous for developing what?

options.text: Techniques for DNA fingerprinting and DNA profiling

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Techniques for DNA fingerprinting and DNA profiling

questions.question: One of these French Kings was not a founder of a royal dynasty.  Which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis XIII the Well-Beloved

questions.question: Shah Rukh Khan, Kajol, Rani Mukherji, and Salman Khan starred together in one of the following famous Bollywood movies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kuch Kuch Hota Hai

questions.question: Woodrow Wilson (the USA), Georges Clemenceau (France) and David Lloyd George (Great Britain) signed a treaty of global importance. Which was the treaty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Treaty of Versailles
